name: Depressed Mood
description: A pervasive feeling of sadness, emptiness, or low mood.

name: Sadness
description: A state of sorrow or unhappiness, often in response to a loss or distressing event.

name: Hopelessness
description: A feeling that the future is bleak and nothing can improve the situation.

name: Helplessness
description: A perceived inability to influence events or outcomes, leading to passivity or despair.

name: Worthlessness
description: A sense of having no value or purpose.

name: Excessive/Inappropriate Guilt
description: Persistent feelings of guilt that are disproportionate or unrelated to actual events.

name: Anhedonia
description: Marked loss of interest or pleasure in previously enjoyable activities.

name: Irritability
description: Easily annoyed or angered by minor stimuli.

name: Anger
description: Strong feelings of displeasure or hostility.

name: Emotional Numbness
description: Reduced emotional responsiveness or detachment from feelings.

name: Mood Lability
description: Rapid and intense shifts in emotional state.

name: Euphoria
description: An intense state of happiness or well-being, often disproportionate to circumstances.

name: Elevated Mood
description: A persistent and abnormally cheerful, expansive, or irritable mood.

name: Expansive Mood
description: Unusually overconfident, grandiose, or uninhibited emotional expression.

name: Dysphoria
description: A state of unease, dissatisfaction, or unhappiness.

name: Anxiety
description: Excessive worry or apprehension about potential threats or future events.

name: Fear
description: An emotional response to real or perceived imminent threat.

name: Panic
description: Sudden, intense episodes of fear or discomfort, often with physical symptoms.

name: Emotional Blunting
description: Reduced intensity of emotional expression.

name: Flat Affect
description: Marked lack of emotional expression, including facial expression, voice, and gestures.

name: Restricted Affect
description: Limited range of emotional expression.

name: Labile Affect
description: Rapid and exaggerated changes in mood or emotional expression.

name: Incongruent Affect
description: Emotional expression that is inconsistent with the content of speech or thought.

name: Tearfulness
description: Frequent crying or shedding of tears, often in response to minimal stimuli.

name: Emotional Reactivity
description: Heightened and immediate emotional responses to stimuli.

name: Apathy
description: Lack of interest, enthusiasm, or concern.

name: Low Frustration Tolerance
description: Difficulty coping with minor inconveniences or stressors.

name: Shame
description: Intense feelings of self-consciousness, embarrassment, or inadequacy.

name: Embarrassment
description: Discomfort or self-consciousness in response to perceived social mistakes.

name: Emotional Detachment
description: Distance from or disconnection with one’s own emotions or the emotions of others.

name: Flight of Ideas
description: Rapidly shifting thoughts that are loosely connected, often seen in manic states.

name: Racing Thoughts
description: Subjective experience of thoughts moving quickly, often uncontrollable and difficult to focus on.

name: Tangentiality
description: Responses that are obliquely related or completely unrelated to the question asked.

name: Circumstantiality
description: Including excessive and unnecessary details before reaching the point of communication.

name: Loose Associations
description: Thoughts that are only minimally connected or unrelated, often seen in psychotic disorders.

name: Thought Blocking
description: Sudden interruption in the flow of thinking, often leaving the individual unable to recall what was being said.

name: Perseveration
description: Repetition of a particular response, word, or phrase despite cessation of stimulus.

name: Clang Associations
description: Association of words based on sound rather than meaning, often rhyming or punning.

name: Neologisms
description: Creation of new, idiosyncratic words or expressions not understood by others.

name: Word Salad
description: Incoherent mixture of words and phrases, often with no logical connection.

name: Illogical Thinking
description: Thoughts that are unreasonable or inconsistent with reality, lacking logical coherence.

name: Concrete Thinking
description: Inability to think abstractly, focusing only on literal or tangible concepts.

name: Poverty of Thought
description: Reduced quantity of thought content, speech, or spontaneous ideas.

name: Overinclusive Thinking
description: Thought processes include irrelevant details or ideas that impede goal-directed thinking.

name: Distractible Thinking
description: Easily sidetracked from the intended train of thought by irrelevant stimuli.

name: Ruminative Thinking
description: Repetitive focus on distressing thoughts, problems, or experiences.

name: Obsessional Thinking
description: Persistent, intrusive, and unwanted thoughts causing distress or anxiety.

name: Magical Thinking
description: Belief that thoughts, words, or actions can influence events in a way that defies conventional cause and effect.

name: Disorganized Thinking
description: Thoughts that are fragmented, illogical, or incoherent, impairing communication.

name: Slowed Thinking (Bradyphrenia)
description: Slowness in thought processes, often seen in depression or neurological disorders.

name: Delusions (General)
description: Fixed false beliefs that are not amenable to reason or contrary evidence.

name: Persecutory Delusions
description: Belief that one is being targeted, harmed, or conspired against.

name: Grandiose Delusions
description: Belief in possessing exceptional abilities, wealth, or fame.

name: Referential Delusions
description: Belief that neutral events, objects, or behaviors have personal significance.

name: Somatic Delusions
description: False belief concerning the body, health, or physical appearance.

name: Nihilistic Delusions
description: Belief that self, others, or the world does not exist or is coming to an end.

name: Erotomanic Delusions
description: Belief that another person, often of higher status, is in love with the individual.

name: Religious Delusions
description: False beliefs involving religious themes or powers.

name: Thought Insertion
description: Belief that thoughts are being placed into one's mind by an external source.

name: Thought Withdrawal
description: Belief that thoughts are being removed or stolen from one’s mind.

name: Thought Broadcasting
description: Belief that one’s thoughts are being broadcasted or shared with others.

name: Overvalued Ideas
description: Ideas held with intense conviction but not fully delusional.

name: Obsessions
description: Recurrent, intrusive thoughts, urges, or images causing anxiety or distress.

name: Intrusive Thoughts
description: Unwanted, distressing thoughts that repeatedly enter the mind.

name: Preoccupations
description: Excessive focus on specific thoughts, topics, or concerns.

name: Phobias
description: Persistent, excessive, or irrational fears of specific objects or situations.

name: Suicidal Ideation
description: Thoughts about wanting to end one’s life.

name: Passive Death Wish
description: Desire to die without active planning or intent.

name: Active Suicidal Ideation
description: Thoughts with intent and possibly a plan to end one’s life.

name: Homicidal Ideation
description: Thoughts of harming or killing another person.

name: Violent Fantasies
description: Imaginations involving acts of aggression or harm to others.

name: Paranoid Ideation
description: Suspicious thoughts or beliefs that others intend harm.

name: Suspiciousness
description: A tendency to mistrust others without sufficient basis.

name: Jealous Delusions
description: False belief that a partner is unfaithful without evidence.

name: Body Image Distortion
description: Distorted perception or beliefs about one’s physical appearance.

name: Health Anxiety Thoughts
description: Excessive worry about having or developing serious illness.

name: Catastrophic Thinking
description: Expectation that the worst possible outcome will occur.

name: Self-Critical Thoughts
description: Harsh or negative evaluation of oneself.

name: Ideas of Guilt
description: Excessive or inappropriate feelings of guilt about real or imagined acts.

name: Ideas of Reference
description: Belief that ordinary events, gestures, or remarks have personal significance.

name: Rumination
description: Repetitive focus on distressing thoughts or problems.

name: Existential Preoccupation
description: Excessive concern with philosophical, spiritual, or meaning-of-life issues.

name: Hopeless Ideation
description: Thoughts centered on the futility of life or lack of future prospects.

name: Moral Scrupulosity
description: Excessive concern with moral or ethical correctness, often intrusive and distressing.

name: Somatic Preoccupation
description: Excessive focus on physical symptoms or bodily functions, often without medical basis.

name: Hallucinations (General)
description: Perceptions in the absence of external stimuli, experienced as real.

name: Auditory Hallucinations
description: Hearing voices or sounds that are not present.

name: Visual Hallucinations
description: Seeing objects, people, or lights that are not present.

name: Tactile Hallucinations
description: Feeling sensations on or under the skin that are not real.

name: Olfactory Hallucinations
description: Smelling odors that are not present.

name: Gustatory Hallucinations
description: Tasting sensations that are not real.

name: Command Hallucinations
description: Voices instructing the individual to perform specific acts.

name: Illusions
description: Misinterpretation of real external stimuli.

name: Depersonalization
description: Feeling detached from one’s self, as if observing oneself from outside.

name: Derealization
description: Sense that the external world is unreal or distorted.

name: Flashbacks
description: Involuntary, vivid recollections of past traumatic events.

name: Intrusive Imagery
description: Unwanted, distressing mental images that repeatedly enter awareness.

name: Distorted Perception of Time
description: Subjective experience of time passing unusually fast or slow.

name: Heightened Perception
description: Increased sensitivity to sensory stimuli.

name: Perceptual Distortion
description: Alteration in the perception of objects or environment, not classified as hallucination.

name: Hypnagogic Hallucinations
description: Hallucinations occurring while falling asleep.

name: Hypnopompic Hallucinations
description: Hallucinations occurring while waking from sleep.

name: Body Distortion
description: Altered perception of body size, shape, or form.

name: Micropsia/Macropsia
description: Perception of objects as smaller (micropsia) or larger (macropsia) than they are.

name: Dissociative Perceptual Changes
description: Alterations in perception associated with dissociative states.

name: Impaired Attention
description: Difficulty sustaining focus on tasks or stimuli.

name: Distractibility
description: Easily diverted from tasks by irrelevant stimuli.

name: Poor Concentration
description: Inability to maintain mental focus over time.

name: Memory Impairment
description: Deficits in recalling information, both short- and long-term.

name: Short-Term Memory Loss
description: Difficulty retaining information over brief periods.

name: Long-Term Memory Loss
description: Difficulty retrieving stored information over extended periods.

name: Working Memory Deficits
description: Reduced capacity to hold and manipulate information in mind temporarily.

name: Confusion
description: Impaired clarity of thought, often with disorientation.

name: Disorientation (Time/Place/Person)
description: Loss of awareness of time, place, or identity of self or others.

name: Slowed Cognition
description: Reduced speed of thought processing or response.

name: Poor Judgment
description: Difficulty making sound decisions or evaluating consequences.

name: Impaired Abstraction
description: Difficulty understanding abstract concepts or figurative language.

name: Concrete Reasoning
description: Thinking limited to literal, tangible, or specific information.

name: Executive Dysfunction
description: Impairment in planning, organizing, and goal-directed behavior.

name: Poor Planning
description: Difficulty anticipating steps and organizing tasks effectively.

name: Decision-Making Difficulty
description: Struggle to choose among options or make appropriate decisions.

name: Cognitive Rigidity
description: Inflexibility in thinking, difficulty adapting to new information or rules.

name: Mental Fatigue
description: Feeling mentally exhausted, with reduced cognitive performance.

name: Brain Fog
description: Subjective sense of clouded, sluggish, or unclear thinking.

name: Reduced Insight
description: Limited awareness of one’s own mental state or condition.

name: Impaired Reality Testing
description: Difficulty distinguishing internal thoughts or perceptions from reality.

name: Poor Impulse Control
description: Difficulty resisting urges, leading to impulsive behavior.

name: Poor Problem Solving
description: Reduced ability to identify solutions or resolve complex issues.

name: Reduced Processing Speed
description: Slowness in perceiving, understanding, or responding to information.

name: Cognitive Overload
description: Overwhelmed by excessive information, leading to impaired functioning.

name: Psychomotor Agitation
description: Excessive, purposeless motor activity often associated with inner tension.

name: Psychomotor Retardation
description: Slowed physical movements and speech, often seen in depression.

name: Restlessness
description: Inability to remain still, constant movement or fidgeting.

name: Hyperactivity
description: Excessive motor activity that is not goal-directed.

name: Impulsivity
description: Tendency to act without forethought or consideration of consequences.

name: Compulsions
description: Repetitive behaviors performed in response to obsessions or rules.

name: Ritualistic Behavior
description: Structured, repeated actions often performed according to specific rules.

name: Avoidance Behavior
description: Deliberate avoidance of feared situations, objects, or people.

name: Social Withdrawal
description: Reduced interaction or engagement with others.

name: Isolation
description: Voluntary separation from social interactions and environments.

name: Aggression
description: Hostile or destructive behavior toward others or objects.

name: Hostility
description: Persistent angry or antagonistic attitude toward others.

name: Violence
description: Behavior intending to cause physical harm or damage.

name: Self-Harm Behaviors
description: Intentional injury inflicted on oneself without suicidal intent.

name: Suicidal Behaviors
description: Actions with intent to end one’s life.

name: Repetitive Behaviors
description: Repeated movements or actions without clear goal.

name: Stereotypies
description: Repetitive, fixed, and purposeless movements or postures.

name: Tics
description: Sudden, rapid, recurrent, non-rhythmic motor movements or vocalizations.

name: Echolalia
description: Repetition of another person's spoken words.

name: Echopraxia
description: Imitation of another person's movements.

name: Catatonia
description: Marked psychomotor disturbance including immobility or excessive motor activity.

name: Mutism
description: Absence of speech in situations where communication is expected.

name: Negativism
description: Resistance or opposition to instructions or external stimuli.

name: Posturing
description: Assuming and maintaining inappropriate or unusual body positions.

name: Mannerisms
description: Odd or exaggerated gestures or movements, often goal-directed.

name: Disinhibition
description: Reduced restraint in behavior, social, or sexual actions.

name: Risk-Taking Behavior
description: Engaging in behaviors with potential harm or danger.

name: Poor Self-Care
description: Neglect of personal hygiene, grooming, or health needs.

name: Wandering
description: Aimless or purposeless movement, often seen in cognitive impairment.

name: Fidgeting
description: Small repetitive movements of hands or body, often due to restlessness.

name: Excessive Worry
description: Persistent, uncontrollable concern about various life events or activities.

name: Anticipatory Anxiety
description: Anxiety experienced in anticipation of future events.

name: Panic Attacks
description: Sudden episodes of intense fear accompanied by physical symptoms.

name: Avoidance
description: Behavior aimed at evading anxiety-provoking situations or stimuli.

name: Hypervigilance
description: Heightened state of sensory sensitivity and alertness to potential threats.

name: Startle Response
description: Exaggerated reaction to sudden stimuli.

name: Muscle Tension
description: Involuntary contraction of muscles associated with anxiety or stress.

name: Restlessness
description: Inability to relax or remain still, often due to anxiety.

name: Fear of Losing Control
description: Worry about acting irrationally or being unable to manage behavior.

name: Fear of Dying
description: Intense anxiety related to the possibility of death.

name: Social Anxiety
description: Fear or apprehension of social situations and potential scrutiny.

name: Performance Anxiety
description: Fear related to performing tasks in front of others.

name: Separation Anxiety
description: Excessive distress when separated from attachment figures.

name: Specific Fears
description: Intense fear of particular objects, situations, or events.

name: Phobic Avoidance
description: Avoidance of feared stimuli to reduce anxiety.

name: Stress Intolerance
description: Difficulty coping with or adapting to stressors.

name: Trauma Re-Experiencing
description: Intrusive memories, flashbacks, or nightmares of traumatic events.

name: Emotional Numbing
description: Reduced ability to experience emotions, often following trauma.

name: Dissociation
description: Disconnection between thoughts, identity, consciousness, and memory.

name: Threat Sensitivity
description: Heightened responsiveness to perceived danger in the environment.

name: Insomnia
description: Difficulty initiating or maintaining sleep despite adequate opportunity.

name: Hypersomnia
description: Excessive sleep duration or daytime sleepiness despite adequate night sleep.

name: Difficulty Falling Asleep
description: Prolonged time to transition from wakefulness to sleep.

name: Early Morning Awakening
description: Waking earlier than desired with inability to return to sleep.

name: Nightmares
description: Disturbing or frightening dreams that awaken the sleeper.

name: Night Terrors
description: Episodes of intense fear, screaming, and autonomic arousal during sleep.

name: Sleep Fragmentation
description: Interrupted sleep with frequent awakenings or transitions to lighter stages.

name: Reduced Need for Sleep
description: Functioning without normal amounts of sleep without fatigue.

name: Excessive Daytime Sleepiness
description: Uncontrollable sleepiness during waking hours.

name: Circadian Rhythm Disturbance
description: Misalignment between sleep-wake schedule and desired or societal timing.

name: Sleep Paralysis
description: Temporary inability to move or speak while falling asleep or waking.

name: REM Behavior Symptoms
description: Acting out dreams during REM sleep due to loss of normal muscle atonia.

name: Poor Sleep Quality
description: Non-restorative sleep or perception of inadequate sleep.

name: Irregular Sleep-Wake Cycle
description: Inconsistent sleep and wake times leading to disrupted patterns.

name: Fatigue
description: Persistent tiredness or exhaustion not relieved by rest or sleep.

name: Appetite Loss
description: Reduced desire to eat or lack of interest in food.

name: Increased Appetite
description: Heightened desire to eat or overconsumption of food.

name: Weight Loss
description: Unintentional reduction in body weight.

name: Weight Gain
description: Unintentional increase in body weight.

name: Fatigue
description: Persistent tiredness or lack of energy not relieved by rest.

name: Low Energy
description: Reduced physical and mental vitality.

name: Psychosomatic Pain
description: Physical pain with a psychological origin rather than medical cause.

name: Somatic Complaints
description: Reports of physical symptoms without clear organic cause.

name: Headaches
description: Pain or discomfort in the head region.

name: GI Distress (Functional)
description: Gastrointestinal discomfort not explained by organic disease.

name: Sexual Dysfunction
description: Difficulties in sexual performance or response.

name: Reduced Libido
description: Decreased sexual desire or interest.

name: Increased Libido
description: Heightened sexual desire or interest.

name: Aches and Pains
description: Generalized bodily discomfort or soreness.

name: Physical Tension
description: Muscular tightness or strain associated with stress or anxiety.

name: Nausea (Psychogenic)
description: Feeling of sickness in the stomach without clear medical cause.

name: Dizziness
description: Sensation of lightheadedness or unsteadiness.

name: Weakness
description: Reduced strength or energy in muscles.

name: Sensory Sensitivity
description: Heightened responsiveness to sensory stimuli such as light, sound, or touch.

name: Autonomic Arousal Symptoms
description: Physical signs of heightened autonomic nervous system activity, e.g., sweating, palpitations.
